location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.3285 of 1852 from Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Letter acknowledging receipt of Kemball's previous correspondence (f 244-46), and requesting that the liberated slaves be sent to the Senior Magistrate of Police at Bombay at the first opportunity, unless they wish to remain free in Bushire. Malet also requests that Kemball remind the Sheikh of Bahrain of his obligations regarding the slave trade, as outlined in his 8 May 1847 engagement.
